creator: RufusTheGreat
title: Solar Powered Clock
materials_required: Solar powered garden light (cheap kind with tiny solar cell, AA rechargeable battery and LED)
Clock that runs on a single AA battery
Multimeter (optional, for determining polarity of solar cell)
description: This project converts a standard AA battery clock into a solar-recharged clock by repurposing the solar cell, rechargeable battery, and battery contacts from a cheap solar-powered garden light.  It's a kid-friendly project that demonstrates reusing modular parts.
steps: Disassemble the solar garden lamp to extract the solar cell, AA rechargeable battery, and battery contacts. Be careful when removing the solar cell as it is fragile.
Determine the positive and negative leads of the solar cell. If unmarked, use a multimeter in DC voltage mode and shine light on the cell. Mark the positive lead.
Connect the battery contacts to the leads of the solar cell. The spring contact is negative. Solder and heat shrink the connections for a better build, or use tightly twisted wire and tape.
Insert the AA rechargeable battery into the clock.
Wedge the solar lamp's battery contacts between the clock and its existing battery contacts.
Mount the solar cell on the back of the clock with tape (or more permanent mounting).
Hang the clock in a window with sufficient light to charge the battery.
